originalText.text: I wish I could‚Äôve spent more time here and brought friends with me. I ordered the Martin, and it was soooo good. The biscuit was perfectly flaky on top and soft in the center, and the chicken seasoned so well. The restaurant and outdoor patio are spacious, and the folks there were very friendly. The decor is inspiring with beautiful art adorning the walls. I‚Äôll be returning on my next visit to the city and recommend you check it out!

originalText.text: Let me start off by letting everyone know just because I didn't enjoy my experience at the Harlem Biscuit Company doesn't mean you shouldn't try. The restaurant is very small (sitting on top of each other small). All food (take out/dine in) is ordered on kiosks up front. Party of four paid a little over $100 with tip which shouldn't be included since we had to get our own utensils üçΩ and had to pick up our sodas and juice from the bar after we ordered and sat.  We had a table right outside of the kitchen so I don't understand how you open the door and hand us the food and it wasn't even hot. Had the bodega which is a bacon ü•ì egg ü•ö and cheese üßÄ biscuit and the cheese wasn't melted. Biscuits were not hot and buttery (you can get a better biscuit from the popeyes next door). Then to top it off when we were getting up to leave the so call waitress who got a tip for nothing told us we had to take the baskets üß∫ our food came in and trash upfront to the garbage canüóë. Expected more from this place. Will not be going back.

originalText.text:
Took a trip uptown and based on reviews we had to visit. Thank goodness we did, we went on a Saturday morning around 10 am
Place was hopping with DJ and the smell of good food. Biscuits and white gravy, oh my a piece of heaven in your belly. Friendly staff, great atmosphere. We will be back.. Special shout out to Pernell

originalText.text:
Excellent and the biscuits are warm, soft and not very sweet. They have a savoury/sweet flavor which works!
Definitely worth a visit.

text.text:
Excellent and the biscuits are warm, soft and not very sweet. They have a savoury/sweet flavor which works!
Definitely worth a visit.

originalText.text: You're here for the biscuits. Stick to the biscuits and you won't go wrong. We tried several of their varieties. All were tasty, good texture and still flaky soft on the inside. Their egg sandwich was on point with the biscuit elevating it. I'd skip the fried chicken. It was hot, which is good, but in an all heat and no flavor kind of way. It was also more oily than crispy. Service was quick and friendly. If they upped their coffee game above Folgers, they'd be a go to breakfast spot.
